name: CheckIn
text message: Hi! Did you praise your child during one-on-one time or any other time during the day?

name: CheckIn
text message: Sorry, I don't understand what you mean.

name: CheckIn
text message: It can be hard sometime to remember. Next time you spend one-on-one time, try and think of one thing you can praise them for. You can even say “thank you for spending time with me!”.

name: CheckIn
text message: Well done, great job for remembering. How did your child or teen respond?
option 3: My child did not like it

name: CheckIn
text message: Sorry, I don't understand what you mean.

name: CheckIn
text message: Remember, it takes some time for your child or teen to get used to you praising them. The more time you spend with them, the better it will go!

name: CheckIn
text message: Well done for noticing how your child or teen felt, keep it up!

name: CheckIn
text message: No problem, try to notice how they respond next time!

name: CheckIn
text message: It happens, just be patient. Make sure to keep spending time with your child or teen, so they will value your opinion more and more. When your praise is genuine, you will see the benefits soon!
